com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface postVoidSale

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface postVoidSale

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document postVoidSale(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      postVoidSale API is used to invalidate a sales transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • postVoidSale

        org.w3c.dom.Document postVoidSale(YFSEnvironment env,
                                  org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                           throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                  java.rmi.RemoteException
        postVoidSale API is used to invalidate a sales transaction. Processing on post voided sales orders will be stopped immediately. Once the sale transaction is recorded again, the processing resumes. If the sale is not recorded within a certain time after marking as Post-Void, the order will be cancelled.

        The postVoidSale API behaves as follows:

        • The order is marked as SaleVoided.
        • The order will be stamped with an AutoCancelDate. If not specified as part of the API call it will be calculated based on 'Mark Post Voided Sale for Auto-Cancellation After' business rule.
        • Refunds made on the POS can be recorded against the order. This will be needed so that any collections already made for the order are refunded.
        • Will throw an error if order is in Draft Order state.
        • Marking a parent order as SaleVoidedwill not mark the child orders or associated work orders as SaleVoided.
        • The cancellation of parent or child order resulting in cancellation of child order or unscheduled of parent will remain the same even if either parent or child order is marked as SaleVoided.


        postVoidSale API uses the following transactions.

        • ORDER_CHANGE - To set SaleVoided flag and AutoCancelDate on the order. Please refer to changeOrder api for information regarding events and user exists.
        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        Please refer to the following API for information regarding user exists.
        • changeOrder


        Events Raised:
        The following event are raised under base transaction ORDER_CHANGE.

        • ON_POST_VOID_SALE:
            This will be raised for any Post Void of a Sale.
            Template Support: Yes.
            Data published: YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_POST_VOID_SALE.xml
            Key data: modifyOrder_dbd.txt

        • ON_POST_VOID_SALE_AFTER_SCHEDULE:
            This event will be raised if the any quantity on the order has already been scheduled and a post void is done.
            Template Support: Yes.
            Data published: YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_POST_VOID_SALE_AFTER_SCHEDULE.xml
            Key data: modifyOrder_dbd.txt

        Please refer to the following API for information regarding additional events.
        • changeOrder


        Audits: Yes.

        Pre-conditions: None.

        Post-conditions: None.

        Output Template Support: Yes.

        Database Extensibility Support: No.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment() API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated XML input and DTD input files.

        Returns:
        None.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes. Click here to see the XML and the associated DTD.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
